entry.title: [iOS] Create the Push Notification Service Extension on Bling.
entry.content:
This CL creates the new Push Notification Service Extension on Bling to

be able to support the use of attachments in images. The extension

overrides `didReceiveNotificationRequest:withContentHandler:` from

Apple's UserNotifications framework and allows for downloads of content

prior to the notification being handled by the app and shown by the

user.

entry.title: webui: show bubble top chrome WebUI immediately if it is ready to show
entry.content:
WebUIBubbleManager::ShowBubble() now shows the bubble immediately if the

contents is preloaded and ready to show.



WebUIContentsWrapperT now loads the contents on its creation, so that

its client no longer needs to call ReloadWebContents() for the initial

loading.



Adds WebUIBubbleManagerObserver which has a BeforeBubbleWidgetShown().

This gives the client of WebUIBubbleManager a chance to add widget

observer before the widget is shown synchronously in ShowBubble().



Bug: 325928324

entry.title: [discarding] Fix crash when navigating a discarded tab.
entry.content:
We have crash reports in this stack:



logging::CheckFailure

content::NavigationControllerImpl::NavigateToExistingPendingEntry

content::NavigationControllerImpl::LoadIfNecessary

resource_coordinator::TabLifecycleUnitSource::TabLifecycleUnit::Load

BrowserList::SetLastActive

BrowserView::OnWidgetActivationChanged

views::Widget::OnNativeWidgetActivationChanged

wm::FocusController::SetActiveWindow

wm::FocusController::FocusAndActivateWindow

content::WebContentsImpl::NotifySwappedFromRenderManager

content::RenderFrameHostManager::CommitPending



content::RenderFrameHostManager::PerformEarlyRenderFrameHostSwapIfNeeded

content::RenderFrameHostManager::GetFrameHostForNavigation

content::RenderFrameHostManager::DidCreateNavigationRequest

content::FrameTreeNode::TakeNavigationRequest

content::Navigator::Navigate

content::NavigationControllerImpl::NavigateToExistingPendingEntry



A focus change occurring as part of navigating a discarded tab makes

TabLifecycleUnit reload the tab. This creates a nested navigation,

which is disallowed. Normally, navigating a discarded tab triggers

a call to TabLifecycleUnit::DidStartLoading() and changes the tab's

state from DISCARDED to ACTIVE, preventing future focus changes from

triggering a discarded tab reload. However, in this case, the focus

change occurs before DidStartLoading() is invoked.



The solution is to skip the reload if WebContents::WasDiscarded() is

false (this bit is unset early when navigating a discarded tab).



Unfortunately, I wasn't able to reproduce the crash to test that the

fix works. Normally, WebContentsImpl::NotifySwappedFromRenderManager

-> WebContentsImpl::NotifyPrimaryMainFrameProcessIsAlive only

triggers a focus change if the `primary_main_frame_process_status_`

is not TERMINATION_STATUS_STILL_RUNNING. However, a discarded tab

should have `primary_main_frame_process_status_` =

TERMINATION_STATUS_STILL_RUNNING so no focus change should occur.



The crash could be related to crrev.com/c/4847998



Bug: 40075246

Change-Id: Ia0d3489f1110ca67b8da06b260496703bd632f56

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5301583

Reviewed-by: Thomas Lukaszewicz

Reviewed-by: Alex Moshchuk

Commit-Queue: Francois Pierre Doray

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1276475}

entry.title: Remove all use of base::ByteSwapToLE* and apply spans
entry.content:
These are replaced with the bounds-safe byte conversion functions in

base::numerics.



Most of the sites doing so were trying to parse a byte stream, and we

have helpers for that now in base::numerics::U*FromLittleEndian, so

make use of those and turn code into using spans. Similarly,

constructing a byte stream in little endian from non-byte-sized

integers can use base::numerics::U*ToLittleEndian to be explicit.



Some code was doing invalid casts from bytes to non-byte-sized

integers which cause UB if the pointers are not correctly aligned,

so these are replaced with the use of byte spans. There were also

casts from structs to arrays of their fields, which is UB, so these

are also adjusted.



memcpy() is replaced with bounds-checked span::copy_from().



Bug: 40284755

Change-Id: I84594ff8ab4a2037e9d33bb6fe0d8ba60d5d7413

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5370942

Reviewed-by: Mark Mentovai

entry.title: Get Ash Chrome working on Graphite Dawn
entry.content:
Lands basic support that allows Graphite to be used on Ash when

enabled. We query the new Graphite API landed in[1] to get supported

DRM format modifiers when creating images. However I also needed to add

a blocklist of formats that use multiple *memory* planes as Dawn does

not currently support multiple memory plane images.



These are needed to enable:

gn args:

use_skia_dawn=true

Launch flag:

--enable-skia-graphite



Known Issues:

- Lacros Chrome does not work. It only renders about 3 frames before

freezing, regardless of whether Graphite is enable for Lacros.

- Videos don't work.



[1] https://dawn-review.googlesource.com/c/dawn/+/179080

entry.title: WebSQL: Remove session data logic
entry.content:
On Profile destruction, currently there is a race with

the DatabaseTracker shutdown. DatabaseTracker shutdown

will post task[1] on the database task runner because

it needs to do file I/O. However it also has some logic

to retrieve info for special storage policies from the

Profile which may already be destroyed by that time.



This change removes logic for special storage policy from

DatabaseTracker. DatabaseTracker(WebSQL) is removed

from all platforms as of M119 except for WebView, which does

not utilize the special storage policy. All policy and

deprecation support have ended with M123. Therefore cleaning

up the code to avoid the race.

entry.content:
This CL adds a new method to `Condition` to check if the

condition-context pair can be properly evaluated. This is necessary so

that conditions like "not(dest(foo.com))" don't evaluate to true in

contexts without a proper destination and accidentally trigger rules.

entry.title: v4l2/stateless: Fence resolution change
entry.content:
When a resolution change occurs any buffers that has

not been dequeued from the driver will result in the

driver being unable to allocate buffers.



A task put in the |queue_task_runner_| after a resolution

change event will not execute until after all of the

buffers associated with the prior sequence are dequeued.

with the zlib wrapper for DEFLATE and PNG decoding.



The original code was written by Alex Chiang and imported

in the Cloudflare zlib fork by Simon Hosie.



Average decompression gain was +14.4% (and only +1% for compression)

with the zlib wrapper running in a Kendryte K230 board.

entry.title: Cast gfx::Size width and height to avoid integer overflow
entry.content:
The associated bug is a clusterfuzz crash caused by integer overflow

that occurs when computing the viewport area size for soft

navigation detection purpose.



This CL is to cast gfx::Size width and height to uint64_t to avoid the

crash.



The cast is safe because the gfx::Size width and height should always

be non-negative, the same cast already exists in the gfx::Size's member

class and the height, the width and the multiplication of the two should

be well within the range of uint64_t.

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:ui/gfx/geometry/size.h;l=56

entry.title: [Tether] Wired SecureChannelTetherAvailabilityOperationOrchestrator to HostScanner
entry.content:
This change replaces a direct call to TetherAvailabilityOperation with

a call to the orchestrator in HostScannerImpl.



As Secure Channel only supports one device as of now, any calls to the

host prioritizer have been removed. A later CL in the stack will reintroduce

this to the orchestrator.



This change also adds a series of test classes to make testing easier.

entry.title: [chromebox_for_meetings] Update hotlog2 mojom
entry.content:
NOTE: nothing in prod is using these interfaces yet;

this can be merged without versioning concerns.



Changes:

1. Get rid of concept of "SourceName" from DataSource.

There is no need for each data source to be cognizant

of its name. Instead, caller can pass a unique name

when adding each source for the data aggregator to

use internally. This removes an awkward async call

when adding each source.

2. Add source_name arg to AddDataSource; see above.

3. Remove ShouldBeUploaded() from DataSource interface.

Data sources that do not intend to upload anything

should simply return an empty array in their Fetch()

implementation.

4. Add Flush() to DataSource interface. This will be run

when recently-fetched data is successfully uploaded

to cloud logging.

5. Return a success value when adding watchdogs. This

is only expected to fail when we aren't tracking

the requested source name.

entry.title: Replace base::ByteSwap and NetToHost usage in media/ and apply spans
entry.content:
This found a few cases of UB where byte arrays were being cast to larger

integer type pointers, which will cause UB if the buffers do not happen

to be aligned correctly for those integers. All these cases were

converted to do the endian conversion without UB.



Some code was defending against being run on a big-endian machine

(which does not exist) so we have clarified that in the code.



A unique_ptr + int is converted to optional> to

represent a lazily constructed heap array with attached bounds.



memcpy() are replaced by span::copy_from() or sometimes eliminated

by working with byte spans directly.



Allow ByteSwap to work on signed values, as std::byteswap does. This

was depended on by some code using the older base helpers.



R=liberato@chromium.org

entry.title: [PM] Clear SiteDataCache without posting a task if PM is on main thread
entry.content:
When clearing history, HistoryService calls

SiteDataCacheFacade::OnURLsDeleted() on the main thread. At this

point it's important to call SiteDataCacheImpl::ClearAllSiteData() to

delete the on-disk history before browser shutdown.



When PM is running on its own sequence SiteDataCacheFacade posts a

BLOCK_SHUTDOWN task to the PM sequence to call ClearAllSiteData().

When RunPerformanceManagerOnMainThread is enabled, the PM sequence is

actually the UI thread which ignores BLOCK_SHUTDOWN, so this task

could be lost. Since the task is already being posted from the UI

thread, this patch fixes the hole by calling ClearAllSiteData()

immediately instead of posting a task. Other tasks posted from

SiteDataCacheFacade also change to direct calls when the PM sequence

is the UI thread, to preserve ordering.



R=fdoray

entry.title: Create BooleanPostNativeParam.
entry.content:
This functions very similarly to PostNativeFlag, where we get an

object that wraps accessing feature information, with a strong stance

on pre/post-native behavior, and an in memory cache. The in memory

cache is particular important because some use cases will access

very frequently, and crossing the JNI every time becomes non-trivial.



This only supports boolean params, and future changes will be required

to support the rest of the param types.

entry.title: Limit use of calc-size() within other expression contexts.
entry.content:
This restricts the use of calc-size() to the toplevel expression and to

the basis of another calc-size() expression. (It should eventually also

be allowed in mix() when we support that.) It implements the

restriction in the same way that the spec describes it: based on the

idea that its type is not a length.

entry.title: Remove composited-animations-rotate-zero-degrees test
entry.content:
This test was added back when we have difficulty testing composited

rendering. When paused, an animation is no longer composited. Thus,

we needed to run on a playing animation. We have a sampling API that

effectively pauses the animation on the compositor, but this API is

not cross-browser compatible. We have cross-browser ways of achieving

the same goal using timing functions. This test no longer adds any

real value and can be safely removed without eroding test coverage.



Handling of zero rotations is addressed in:

wpt/css/css-transforms/animation/support/transform-interpolation-reftests.js





Bug: 40280753

Change-Id: Ifd78588f972cf72cf28353a05eb6f9ec9dc4a272

entry.title: [profile] Refactor profile color persistence logic
entry.content:
Currently we update profile colors only in the case of a user

having an explicitly set profile color (for autogenerated or

refresh themes).



This CL now always updates profile color regardless of theme

state. This serves to preserve the user's current color scheme

state.



Default profile colors are now only used for Chrome Web Store

extension themes and system themes (linux x11). In all other

cases profile colors will be generated based on the applied

theme. This is true for autogenerated themes and all cases of

the new chrome refresh suite of themes.



See screenshots below for changes with differing system and

browser color schemes when using the chrome default theme.



Light:

before: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/3Whjs4jyFBBxaad.png

after: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/BKjtQPGRVodDQVJ.png

Dark:

before: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/AHZCVrDPeLjrVUg.png

after: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/BYQrrX3AGZCkkAh.png



Bug: 40924613

entry.content:

failing the test at that time. It was left as "tentative"

browsers, there is no need to call it tentative now.

entry.title: iwa: Inject CSP and CO*P headers in URLLoader instead of NavigationRequest
entry.content:
This moves CSP and CO*P header injection from NavigationRequest in

//content to IsolatedWebAppURLLoader. This is one of the biggest pieces

of IWA-specific logic in //content, which will now be in //chrome with

the rest of the IWA core. This also switches the injection from being

based on on WebExposedIsolationInfo to being tied to the IWA

URLLoaderFactory, which is more correct as these restrictions are a

property of IWAs, not the isolation level.



This should fix a few crashes we were seeing when pages inject extra

CSP, and will allow us to customize the injected CSP in the future based

on data from the WebAppDatabase, which we can't currently do.



This adds some additional tests and largely rewrites the existing tests

to be based on existing IWA test helpers.



Bug: b/323257846

Change-Id: Iac6e351478bbd387c966341971dd99bb0c0c4be6

entry.title: libaom: Disable quantization matrix
entry.content:
Quantization Matrix is not used for realtime.

And libaom decoder has been disabled, so Quantization Matrix

can be disabled though it's shared between the encoder and decoder.



Reduces the binary size of the libaom shared lib on linux by about 0.4MB.

entry.title: Chrome gcapi: use IProcessLauncher SxS IID introduced by the Updater
entry.content:
This CL makes gcapi query for the IProcessLauncherSystem IID first,

with a fallback to the legacy IProcessLauncher IID. This is to make sure

that marshaling loads the proxy/stub from the correct (HKLM) hive.



Omaha3 incorrectly registers the IProcessLauncher IID for both user and

system installs, even though IProcessLauncher is only meant for system,

which can cause marshaling failures if the Omaha3 user install is broken

with a system Omaha4, hence this change.



Bug: 329169242

Change-Id: I29ee73d158d350cb4f45222933936be868aa38ba

entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 872620ee34e127b714c3f59a05774f665042b2f7



In this reland, we post registerReceiver calls to a sequencedTaskRunner and the unregister call to the sequencedTaskRunner. Serializing these calls should ensure the register calls occur before the unregister call.

> Posting registerLocaleChangeReceiver to BG thread

entry.title: ChromeDriver: Plumb Chrome's StackTrace.
entry.content:
There are dangling pointers on Mac:

https://issues.chromium.org/issues/330009945



WebDriver do not report the crash, making this impossible to debug. This

patches adds this information to the exception.



Error example:

```

exceptions.UnknownError: unknown error: session deleted because of page crash

from unknown error: cannot determine loading status

from tab crashed

(Session info: chrome=124.0.6366.0)



StackTrace:



#0 0x7f619797f46c base::debug::CollectStackTrace() [../../base/debug/stack_trace_posix.cc:1039:7]

#1 0x7f6197931d3a base::debug::StackTrace::StackTrace() [../../base/debug/stack_trace.cc:234:12]

#2 0x7f6197931cf5 base::debug::StackTrace::StackTrace() [../../base/debug/stack_trace.cc:231:28]

```



Bug: chromium:330009945

entry.title: Improve latency of createAuctionNonce.
entry.content:
This change replaces the implementation of createAuctionNonce so that

the Renderer process can immediately fulfill the Promise, removing

potential latency caused by a loss of the Renderer thread in the caller

to createAuctionNonce.

entry.title: [DownloadBubble] Fix bad CHECK in DownloadBubbleAccessibleAlertsMap
entry.content:
This CHECK was assuming that base::Time always increases monotonically,

which is not correct as system clocks can jump backwards sometimes. The

incorrect CHECK was causing crashes, so this removes it. The condition

is incorporated into the logic of ShouldBeReplacedBy instead.

entry.title: Ignore app shim re-open events triggered by notification actions.
entry.content:
When the user clicks on a notification, macOS sends our app a "re-open"

event. We don't actually want to treat notification clicks as re-open

triggers though. Since there doesn't seem to be a good way to detect

specifically these re-open events, this CL instead ignores re-open

events for a small time period after handling a notification click.



While this change does prevent a app window from being opened when we

don't want it to, unfortunately the OS still makes the PWA be the

active app (regardless of if it has any windows open). But that is

at least less disruptive than opening an extra window would be.



Bug: 330202394
